channel.title: A nice computer
channel.description:
I'm looking to build a really great computer, but have no knowledge of doing so. I'm going to list out what I want to be able to do, and hopefully someone can get me a build out together.
prices not too big of a deal, because I'll but it part by part in time. thought I want this to last at least 5 years.
a good amount of memory, at least 500g (ssd or hdd) a good amount of ram preferably 6-8 g dual boot windows and Linux a great graphics card so I can actually play modern games on best settings a good sounds card a great processor, not sure how to ask because idfk anything good cooling. computer will be on for long periods at a time. don't want anything to overheat.
this is all I can think of.

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:13, topic:535331”]If you want a great computer that will last 5 years, why waste 2.7k+ on it? You can get very great computer for way less.[/quote]yeah you can there was a $1k budget I built on pcpartpicker a while back but don’t think I saved it

here it is

keep in mind this is very barebone

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/1cvAX

Read full topic

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

If you want a great computer that will last 5 years, why waste 2.7k+ on it? You can get very great computer for way less.

Read full topic

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:10, topic:535331”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654137.msg4382094#msg4382094 date=1383915825]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654137.msg4381974#msg4381974 date=1383859191]
Merry Christmas

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/1YRGB
[/quote]is all that compatible and will it all fit inside the case?
i don’t want to start buying parts and then not be able to get it all together.
[/quote]To my knowledge yes

I have a friend who has the case and let me tell you the case is huge. You won’t have any problems sli/crossfiring later!

The R9 290X is still pretty new. It’s like the 2nd best card out on the market at the moment.[/quote]no idea what sli or cross firing is lol, but thanks. ill probably buy the case and board first.

thanks.
[/quote][quote=“Travas, post:11, topic:535331”]SLI/CrossFire = multiple GPUs[/quote]^ pretty much here is an article

http://www.overclock.net/t/478578/faq-everything-you-need-to-know-about-sli-and-crossfirex

here is a cool build using that case so you can get an idea of what the case looks like/it also uses dual gpus

http://pcpartpicker.com/b/FZv

IF you ever do decide to go crossfire use the 1st and 3rd slot! 3way/4way for the msot part is kind of overkill to be honest not to mention the heat will be unbearable.

Read full topic

The R9 290X is still pretty new. It’s like the 2nd best card out on the market at the moment.

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:8, topic:535331”]was messing with this and found a 2k video card wtf?
http://pcpartpicker.com/p/1Zbji[/quote]that doesn’t mean it’s the best card out there. The titan and the R9290X most likely have better specs ( I can’t seem to find the specs for that particular card you showed though? )

Edit: the 9800 is actually fairly old so i think it would be fair to say iit isn’t one of the big gaming monsters.

Edit: and from what I understand the Quadro/Firepro series are really more for businesses that have to do with graphical stuff such as imaging?

Read full topic

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:535331”]Merry Christmas

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/1YRGB[/quote]is all that compatible and will it all fit inside the case?
i don’t want to start buying parts and then not be able to get it all together.
[/quote]To my knowledge yes

I have a friend who has the case and let me tell you the case is huge. You won’t have any problems sli/crossfiring later!

The R9 290X is still pretty new. It’s like the 2nd best card out on the market at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:5, topic:535331”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=654137.msg4381992#msg4381992 date=1383862759]
You really don’t need a sound card.
[/quote]not really knowledgeable about anything internal. I just have a shitty laptop and it’s sound card/video card crashes a lot. so I just want something amazing and reliable to last me through college and then some.

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654137.msg4381974#msg4381974 date=1383859191]
Merry Christmas

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/1YRGB
[/quote]is all that compatible and will it all fit inside the case?
i don’t want to start buying parts and then not be able to get it all together.[/quote]

It is compatible. IIRC pcpartpicker detects incompatibilities and doesn’t display them in the list if they are incompatible with the other parts.

Read full topic

item.title: A nice computer
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

I’m looking to build a really great computer, but have no knowledge of doing so. I’m going to list out what I want to be able to do, and hopefully someone can get me a build out together.

prices not too big of a deal, because I’ll but it part by part in time.
thought I want this to last at least 5 years.

a good amount of memory, at least 500g (ssd or hdd)
a good amount of ram preferably 6-8 g
dual boot windows and Linux
a great graphics card so I can actually play modern games on best settings
a good sounds card
a great processor, not sure how to ask because idfk anything
good cooling. computer will be on for long periods at a time. don’t want anything to overheat.

this is all I can think of.

Read full topic
